column1: The '''Brandywine Bridge''' was the bridge on the [[East Road]] crossing the River [[Baranduin]]; it marked the eastern border of [[the Shire]].<ref>{{FR
Originally called the '''Bridge of Stonebows''', when the [[Hobbits]] first settled in [[the Shire]] the [[Kings of Arnor]] required them to keep the Great Bridge in repair.<ref>{{FR
Although unmentioned in his memoirs, [[Bilbo Baggins]] undoubtedly crossed and recrossed the bridge in {{TA
column5: TA}}</ref> on his adventure to the [[Lonely Mountain]].

column1: [[Frodo Baggins]] and his companions did not use the bridge when they left the Shire in {{TA
column3: n}}.  However, on their return trip they came to the bridge on [[30 October]] {{TA
column6: Chief}}</ref>  To their surprise they found the bridge blocked on both ends with two spiked gates.  Despite a sign proclaiming "No admittance between sundown and sunrise" the four hobbits made their way over the bridge, after dispatching [[Bill Ferny]].  They stayed the night at the guard-house before moving on to rouse the Shire.<ref>{{RK

column3: Elessar]] rode to the Brandywine Bridge and greeted his old friends (but did not cross into the Shire for he himself had forbidden men to enter the land in an edict of {{FoA
column4: 6}}).  At this meeting he bestowed the [[Star of the Dúnedain]] on [[Samwise Gamgee]] and made Sam's daughter [[Elanor Gardner
column5: Elanor]] a maid of honour to Queen [[Arwen]].<ref>{{App

column1: In [[Sindarin]], the name of the bridge was '''''i Varanduiniant'''''. ''[[i]]'' is the singular definite article "the", which causes the initial ''b-'' in ''[[Baranduin#Etymology
column3: lenited]] form ''v-'' (i.e., ''Varanduin''); the final element ''[[iant]]'' means "bridge".<ref>{{VT

column1: :The Brandywine Bridge is a landmark in the Bridgefields. Talking to a character near the bridge starts the quest "The Tale of the Shipwrecked Mariners".<ref>{{webcite
'''[[2010]]: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: Aragorn's Quest]]'':'''
:The meeting of Elessar and the Mayor in {{FoA
column2: 15}} is featured in a cutscene after the last mission. It is portrayed as a low, wooden bridge.<ref name="YouTube">"[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QZxeX7tYekQ Lord of the Rings Aragonr's Quest Walkthrough Black Gates pt 2 ]", [http://www.youtube.com YouTube] (accessed 30 June 2012)</ref>
